column4: err. when the new "updates" are processed.. does it automatically clear archives?
no, you can do it manually easily though
sudo apt-get clean or "sudo apt-get autoclean", depending on what you want to do
correct.
alright, well, now you know how anyway ;)
would you happen to know how to increase the number of simultanous connections apt can do ?
dvd install lets you do raid and stuff?
DVD has debian installer and ubiquity available, so yes.
but, 4G vs 700M is quite a bit of overhead if all you're trying to do is install.  Grab the alternate CD instead
gotta distrib them .. so its alrite.. people dont like text installers anymore
and i need them to try it
You can't do RAID in ubiquity, even on the DVD.  You'll need to go text for that, whehter on the DVD or the alternate CD
At least, I believe Ubiquity can't still do RAID and other things like that (LVM for instance).  I may be wrong as of Hardy, as I haven't completely updated my mind yet.

`deb [repository] ubuntu main restricted universe multiverse` then replace ubuntu with ubuntu-updates and ubuntu-security.  That's all there is to it.  Also, remove restricted/multiverse/universe if you don't want to use those
Oh.  What version of Ubuntu is it?
You'll have to go feisty -> gutsy -> hardy
You don't need to change sources.list to upgrade: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/GutsyUpgrades#head-f2435a45758bb5836f8e5b87e90045463f8c6ec7
Install bootchart and find out whats holding you up.
still on live cd
the site?
